JOINT S.. 2 ..
You are my only daughter. Therefore, out of the natural love, admiration and faith I have in you, I have a firm determination to live your life comfortably and to settle the immovable property of my ancestors for you, and I have chosen love as the reward and I have decided to give you a sum of Rs. 16,21,000/- (Sixteen lakhs and twenty-one thousand rupees in words).
You shall enjoy the said settlement property as you wish, paying the dues, Panchayat taxes, etc., and shall enjoy it with your sons, grandsons, descendants, and descendants, with all the exclusive and absolute rights of donation, inheritance, exchange, and sale. In so doing, you, your heirs, and my subjects shall never have any claim or dispute over the said settlement property.
I will settle all such claims and disputes, regardless of who caused them, at my own expense, and indemnify and pay any losses you may incur, and I will enforce this Settlement Agreement without delay. I hereby declare that I have not committed any encumbrances on the property in this settlement, that I have no rights or liabilities whatsoever, including court seizures, injunctions, joint shareholdings, other agreements, other securities, etc., and that I alone have all rights and liabilities in this property, that I have not committed any mortgage, encumbrance, etc. to anyone, and that I have settled this property with you as a property and have now filed this settlement deed in writing. This property is not a mortgaged property. Settlement Property Details
The property, which is situated in the Elurupadu Gram Panchayat Area of Elurupadu Taluk, Kalla Mandal, West Godavari District, and which is inherited by me through my father, and which I enjoy full possession of with all due rights, is the property settled on you in R.C.C. Daba, R.S. No. 112/2, and the boundaries of the property are 193.6 sq. BiyosabaSheet Endorsement

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 254 of 2026, dated 28/Jan/2026, executed by Birudugadda Yesebu, in favour of his Daughter, Birudugadda Glory, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 193.6 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 5-9, Assessment No. 566, comprised in survey number 112/2, situated in Elurupadu Village and Gramapanchayat, Kalla Mandal, within the District of West Godavari, registered at sub-registrar office Akividu, is bounded as follows: North by: Property of Kona Josaph South by: Property of Birudugadda Moshea East by: Donor Property and Often Panchayathi Road West by: Property of Darsi Sanjeevarao
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible
